While I slightly prefer the food at Haji Baba's and Efe's/Med Fresh Grill, MEB&D is delicious enough that I can avoid the trip to Tempe. And I noticed some pictures adorning the walls in MEB&D of a wedding they had catered--I've now given up committed bachelorhood for the possibility of a wedding catered with such an awesome Middle Eastern food spread.  My only complaints are technical.   The hours are short: MEB&D closes at 8pm and on all day on Sundays. And the parking lot looks like it could get tight during a busy lunch rush, which I've avoided so far.

The food in this market and cafe are great but what is exceptional is that the owners show an unparalleled hospitality and kindness that shows how centered they are around connected relationships with the community. They evoke joy. Also, if you like pickles, a must-try is the pink pickles turnips dyed in vinegar and beet juice. Wow.

This place is GREAT! I picked up lunch to go and asked for a recommendation on the fastest meal, which was the Lebanese chicken plate. The chicken was very flavorful, you could taste the fresh lemon. The meal came with a large side of rice and salad. Honestly, it was enough food for two. Will definitely be back. It's one of the healthiest options for lunch if you work nearby and are pressed for time.

Tiny little place with a mini middle eastern market inside, park in the large lot in the back if the 4 spaces in the front are taken. Started with the hummus really good with soft pita bread, the gyro sandwich meat was chewy, on the soft pita with tomatoes and a lot of onions.  A winner is the rosewater lemonade subtle but great tasting.

Lunch is busy!! But we took it to go! DELICIOUS. Had the combo, Turkish coffee and their infamous lemonade!  Yes, all the reviews are correct...it's a delicious food with great service, smiles and nice things at the register to buy...spices, cookies ect... just go, you won't regret it I promise!

Yup, this place is very good.   Friendly service... check! Fair prices... check! AMAZING food... check! Best Lemonade I've ever had... check!  They are also very knowledgeable about their food ingredients, so if you have food allergies or prefer not to indulge in certain ingredients, you will have no problem dining here.  I personally recommend the Lamb, it was fantastic.

Great shop with cafe and bakery attached. Reminded me of the small shops in the Middle East. Lots of interesting items and stock frequently changes. Tandoori Chicken Salad and some pita makes for a great picnic lunch. Shawarma is great and so are the salads. Browse through the store and find items like chocolate covered candied orange peel, saffron rock candy, or Tapuzina Orange drink (my favorite when I lived in Israel). Friendly staff.

After failing to get to a different restaurant in this neighborhood before they close, Monica O and I found ourselves at Middle Eastern, and I'm glad we did! This little grocery/restaurant is very cute with friendly staff and delicious food. I had trouble making up my mind (what's new?) and the lady behind the counter helped me.. I had the falafel pita.... it had fresh crisp lettuce, slice onion, tomato, and teeny tiny delicious falafel inside... oh and some kind of magic sauce. Wonderful! I also got to try the hummus, which was extremely tasty. Now, you may wonder how I got out of there without ordering a dessert as they all looked insanely tasty... I didn't see them until after I paid (ha!). Anyway, I will definitely be back here!

What can I say, the food is just delicious. The lemonade is something I actually have cravings for. It's nice to see so many people in this mom and pop restaurant. We will be returning on a regular basis.

This place has very authentic middle eastern food that will leave you satisfied and is probably my favorite in all of Phoenix. Expect great flavors, fresh ingredients, good service and a place to buy in bulk many of the components of the meal you order there.  I recommend the combo plate for you first time- you get to try a little bit of everything- the hummus, tabouleh, babaganouj, falafel, dolmas, kibbeh, gyro, tszatsiki and bread. The tabouleh is super fresh and flavorful and the babaganouj is some of the best I have had.

Schawarmamamamamaaaaa?  I love schawarmas in general! This is what I expect in Schawarma - for the meat to be delicious, thinly sliced full of flavors!   So what did I think of the meat at this place? First of all.. why isn't it thinly sliced? But it was very tasty and full of flavors!   I like the schawarma to be wrapped properly in its pita in foil. The pita is on the side and you stuff it yourself. There's a lot of meat - the way it should be! The tahini sauce is good.  I like the tabbouleh - refreshing. Whenever you add olive oil with vegetables and toss it together with small diced vegetables, how can you go wrong? You can't! I toss some of it in my schawarma because whenever I eat schawarmas....I like it when it has thinly sliced meat with tahini, tomatoes, lettuce and grilled onions - maybe I am asking for too much or I don't know what an authentic schawarma is (this is what I get back at Undergrad - if you went to Davis, Sam's is SOO GOOD!)!  Guy at the counter is super nice. They gave us the wrong dishes at first, we stared at it for awhile...then he realized it, he apologized and just took it and brought it to the other table - made us laugh :) because...  1) He just assumed we didn't touch the food 2) He could have given us free food for doing that 3) He could've left the pita and gave us the couple a new pita 4) The couple who received our food did NOT notice it was sitting at our table for 5 minutes  I might go back again if other people insist but I probably won't insist. I had my taste of it.   FYI - I walked in and I was surprised to see a market - that's all.

The baklava is made in house, and they have gluten free tabouleh and pitas.  Not too shabby!  The Greek salad is small for the price, but so tasty, it's worth the money.  Don't worry-just order it.  it misses 4 stars for a few reasons.  Some of the packaged goods seem aged. It's really hot in there. The gyro meat is weird. They microwaved my meat pie....

The only thing that saved this from two stars was the baba ganoush and Gabi!  We shared a plate of the baba and hummus.  Covered with veggies and olive oil.  This was better than my actual lunch, which was a small Greek salad.   Uh...Greek????  It was romaine lettuce, a few chopped red peppers and purple onion slices with...Italian dressing.  Read: tasted just like WishBone.  Seriously.  I was disappointed, because I've read the reviews.  Maybe I just need to try other stuff.  It had a store inside, too, but I didn't have much time to check the shelves. Oh, and they pushed the lemonade BIG TIME!  Neither one of us wanted  it, but they did give us a free cup of it.  It was pretty good! I'll go again.

This place always makes us feel at home. They are a credit to the community and if you are a fan of Middle Eastern food, you owe it to yourself to pay them a visit. They have the best shawarma in town, bar none! My girlfriend chose this place above all other restaurants in Phoenix to celebrate her birthday. We mentioned this in passing to the waitstaff, not for any reason or expectation. We were shocked to have several of the cooks, servers and even the owner come over and sing her a Happy Birthday. In fact, the owner was smiling ear to ear to hear the reason we were there! They even brought out celebratory Turkish coffee and baklava for us to enjoy after our meal! Been going there for years and that touch of kindness will keep us going back for many more! That, and the lemonade - it is addicting!
The best food in Arizona! If you want to eat like Anthony Bourdain, god rest his soul, eat here. It's authentic food, spiced well and plain delicious! On top of that - the owners are the sweetest!

Hands down, the best falafels ever.  Perfectly crunchy on the outside and so flavorful.  I love their lamb kabobs too.  Their simple rice and salad are so tasty.  I also like their eggplant sandwich...and it is even better when you put falafels in the sandwich.  Mmmmmmm!  Lemonade is ok, a tad too sweet for me.  A perfect place for a satisfying lunch!

This was my first visit to this place in about 9-12 months.  The food is always outstanding, so no issues there.  Today I got the Lamb Shiskabob plate, but substiuted chicken for beef.  It comes with either Greek Salad or Tabouli, and I always order the Tabouli.  As always, the food is delish!  The rice has a nice buttery taste to it, and the meat is well-seasoned and tasty (although a little on the dry side -- just a little).  The lemonade, which is made using orange flower water, is so refreshing and delicous -- this is a must if you come here!  So why am I only giving 3 stars?  I am disappointed because they have raised their prices, but are giving less food.  For people who are new to this place, it's not a big deal because they don't know any different.  But not knowing they changed their menu, I placed my order over the phone using an old menu.  The old menu says that my entree is served with tomatoes and onions, in addition to the rice and Tabouli, so I was quite disappointed to not see any tomatoes or onions in my dish when I opened it (they are also not listed on the new menu).  It also looks like they are skimping on the meat.    On the old menu, these were the prices of the items I ordered: entree - $8.99; hummus - $2.99; and lemonade - $1.29.  These are the prices on the new menu: entree - $9.89; hummus - $3.99; and lemonade - $1.99.    I know, I know, if an extra $2.60 is going to send me into bankruptcy, then I shouldn't be eating out anyway.  However, it's more of the principal of the matter.  I don't mind paying a little more money if I'm getting a little more food.  But to raise prices and then give us less food?  That's just a food sin!  This sin won't prevent me from coming back again, but I just had to express my sincere displeasure with this. :)  BTW, I agree with other reviewers that the owners are extremely nice people!

They have GLUTEN FREE PITAS!!!!!!!!!!!! And they're fuggin cheap! Like $3.50 a package or something ridiculous like that. You can sub your pita with your meal for a GF pita at no cost.  I'm eating one as I type this, no joke. I'm now a starch addict again thanks to Middle Eastern Bakery & Deli. I don't know if that's a good thing or not ;)   Seriously, I can't say enough good things about this place. Their rice is to-die-for. The lamb and kafta kabobs are the best. I've found the chicken kabobs can be a little dry at times so I generally go for the darker meats. The salads are the best I've ever had, their dressing is amazing. Oh, and their lemonade is the best. It's made with rose water and honey, you HAVE to try it! I'm not a huge lemonade drinker so I usually get an Arnold Palmer to cut the sweetness, or as the owner likes to call it, an "Arnold Schwarzenegger." Seriously, get the lemonade or an Arnold Schwarzenegger, you won't be disappointed.   Every Friday I work in downtown Phoenix and come here to pick up a multiple packs of gluten-free pitas and get a fab lunch. I always think I'll try someplace else close to downtown but I just can't pass this place up.   The owner is super knowledgeable about his food and extremely sweet. Everyone that works there is very, very friendly and knowledgeable. LOVE, LOVE, LOVE this place!

Lived here for 6 months and just recently discovered this place.. a true gem. Hands down best deli/bakery in town! Agree with the other comments about the owner's generosity with the amazing lemonade. Have already gone twice in 3 days!!! Please do yourself a favor and check this place out!

So delicious and authentic. My moms first time trying Mediterranean food, so we had the combo platter. All was excellent, but chicken was our favorite of the meats. Their Greek salad is excellent! Pickled onions put it over the top. If I'm ever back in the area, I'd like to try their Lebanese chicken next time.

I love, love this place! We had the great fortune of meeting Isam, the owner, and Tina. Isam introduced us to their lemonade made with rose water and honey. It was outstanding -- a unique wonderful flavor you can't forget. Their food is even better -- freshly made everything. Their falafel is excellent; the tahini sauce, thick and tasty (not like the watery stuff at other place); and their meet dishes grilled to perfection. To top it off, we enjoyed the freshest baklava I've had in a decade with a perfect cup of Turkish coffee (with a touch of cardamon). Authentic, fresh, unbeatable Middle Eastern food! Thank you, Isam!
UPDATE!!!!  I found a nice 5star middle eastern that has just been open 2 months; Habbouz Tunisian at 27th ave & Northern. Check it out!!

Awesome food. I have eaten here for over 20 years. The chicken gyro is my favorite. Today I went there with my daughter. We met our good friend for lunch. The Bakery has delicious Pita bread for sale too. They have both regular Pita bread and gluten free Pita bread too. The baklava is perfectly flaky and sweet.

Shwarma!!!!!! SOOOOOOO GOOOOOODDDDDD!!!!! Love this place. The owner is a great guy who is easy to talk to and full of interesting stores about living in Chicago and moving to Phoenix. The food is worth more than you pay and the LEMONADE IS AMAZING!!! he uses rose water or something. I'm drooling thinking about it now.  As a bonus, the market has great middle eastern and Mediterranean stuff to pickup. Their Feta is GREAT!! puts safeway crap to same. Great place to pick up a quick lunch or filling dinner.

This place is absolutely a treat if you love Mediterranean cooking as authentic as a mom-and-pop store/restaurant the service was outstanding ,they had all kinds a middle eastern treats that were delicious I picked up a bag of roasted pistachios sprinkled with lime. The food was amazing from the  chicken  to the lamb it was fantastic

This place is amazingly fresh and delicious. Everything was seasoned very nicely. Service was friendly and helpful! Avoid the lunch rush! It got really busy! Would definitely come back again. Lemonade was bomb. Support your local businesses!!!

Love the vegetarian sampler, which I usually get with wheat pitas. Delicious falafel. And I think their baklava nests are also quite nice. You can taste just a hint of flower in there which is lovely.  They use the same flower essence in the lemonade, which I have to say *is* pretty good, especially since I don't really like lemonade. Its way too sweet though. Once I took it home and watered it down which made it much more refreshing. Otherwise I feel like I need some water to wash down the lemonade.

I had the hummus with beef and it was really tasty. I wish the pitas served with it were warm, though. I also had the gyro plate with salad. The gyro was decent, not the best I've ever had but it was good none the less the salad was fresh and the dressing and tzatziki sauce was SOOOOO GOOD! I also really enjoyed a pink/red pickled vegetable that was in the salad. Whatever it was, they were delicious. The owners were super friendly. I am looking forward to trying their desserts- they had sold out when I was there.
